results.title: Les Annees Folles = the Crazy Years
results.brief_description:
Episode 25 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This episode takes a particular interest in the development of aviation, from the first experiments by Otto Lilienthal in 1895 through to Lindbergh’s 1924 flight across the Atlantic. Other subjects include: the the 1929 Krach and the economic depression, the annexion of Austria by Hitler in 1938 as well as a survey of intellectual life in Paris in between the wars.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Les Annees Folles = the Crazy Years
results.brief_description:
The Roaring Twenties (The Crazy Years) were a time of carefree living, unbridled creativity and political upheaval. This documentary is a made up of a compilation of newsreels from the archives of Pathe and Gaumont.

Credits: Directors, Henri Torrent, Mirea Alexandresco ; music, Georges Van Parys, Georges Tzipine ; narration, Serge Reggiani.
results.description:

results.title: Les Animaux = the Animals
results.brief_description:
Les animaux’ unveils nine aspects of animal life: origins of life, underwater world, species of four regions of the world, animal language, nocturnal animals, struggle for life, play, love.

Credits: Director, Frederic Rossif ; writer, Frederic Rossif ; photography, Georges Barsky.
Cast: Maurice Escande [narration].
results.description:

results.title: Les Anges du Peche = Angels of the Streets
results.creator_credit: Dominique Drouin, Roland Tual and Robert Bresson
results.brief_description:
Filmed during WWII, Robert Bresson’s first feature was shot entirely at night. Establishing a precedent that he would follow in his later films, Bresson utilises non-professionals in the leading roles. Rich young Anne-Marie thinks she has found her vocation when she joins a Dominican convent as a novice. The convent specialises in rehabilitating female prisoners, and Anne-Marie becomes especially fascinated with Therese, trying to get her to join the convent to redeem her for her sins - but Therese protests her innocence and refuses the offer. Upon her release, Therese kills her lover, and seeks refuge from the police in Anne-Marie’s convent. Further reading: Paul Schrader, “Transcendental Style in Film : Ozu, Bresson, Dreyer”, DaCapo, 1988. Further reading: Film Comment. ‘Special Bresson’. May/June and July 1999

Credits: Producers, Dominique Drouin, Roland Tual ; director, Robert Bresson ; writers, Jean Giraudoux, (Rev. Pere) Raymond Leopold Bruckberger, Robert Bresson ; photography, Philippe Agostini ; music, Jean-Jacques Grunenwald.
Cast: Renee Faure, Jany Holt, Sylvie, Marie-Helene Daste, Silvia Monfort, Mila Parely, Louis Seigner.

results.title: Les Anges de la Route
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
Olympe and the last members of the Corps de Ballet are finally on their way to the airport. On the roof of their car, they are carrying a huge accessories basket containing Coppelia and the treasure. Not far behind, Stephane and Lulu are making sure that the basket duly goes through customs. Stephane who was due to take his cabaret show to Las Vegas is informed by Morales that he must follow the ballet to Canada and supervise the return of the real jewels to the Canadian contact. Meanwhile, the injured nightwatchman is making interesting revelations to Inspector Boudot.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix Marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: Les Anciens de Saint-Loup = the Old Boys of Saint-Loup
results.brief_description:
Thre former students of the St Loup college reunite to investigate the mysterious murder of the director’s niece.

Credits: Producer, Jacques Roitfeld ; director, Georges Lampin ; writers, Pierre Very, Georges Lampin ; photography, Louis Page ; music, Georges van Parys.
Cast: Bernard Blier, Odile Versois, Francois Perier, Monique Melinand, Serge Reggiani.

results.title: Leopold: the see-through crumbpicker (K)
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Kratky Film, William Bernal and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Leopold is an invisible creature who creates havoc as he devours every crumb in sight. How his good friend Minerva renders him visible - and where he ends up when she does - is the amusing outcome of this action-filled tale. Based on the book written and illustrated by James Flora.

results.title: Leonor = Expulsion of the Devil
results.brief_description:
During the middle-ages, Lord Richard is away at the war when he learns of the death of his wife, Leonor. Stricken with grief, he burries her in the crypt of his castle and re-marries that same night with a young girl, Catherine. Thanks to Catherine and their two children, Richard is re-born, but still has difficulties forgetting his first wife. He decides to re-open the crypt and live there with Leonor, in spite of a warning from an old man that reviving the dead can be an extremely hazardous activity. Soon after, Leonor comes out of the crypt to resume life with Richard and asks him to kill Catherine and the children.

Credits: Director, Juan Bunuel ; writers, Jean-Claude Carriere ; Juan Bunuel, Michel Nuritzani, Pierre Maintigneux ; photography, Luciano Tovoli ; music, Ennio Morricone.
Cast: Liv Ullman, Michel Piccoli, Ornella Mutti, Antonio Ferrandis.

results.title: Leong, Angela: a cultural transition
results.creator_credit: R P Birch and Associates, Film Australia, Jan Sharp and Tony Wheeler
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Leong, a Malaysian born Chinese, and Angela, an Australian born Chinese, both talk about their attitudes towards being assimilated into Australian society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: R P Birch and Associates, Film Australia, Jan Sharp and Tony Wheeler
